ReferenceDocuments.name: What was name of the lab sub-
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was name of the lab sub-panel?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form  Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the lab test subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

ReferenceDocuments.name: LBSCAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology (e.g. Electrolytes, Liver Function). This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.

DataElement.changeDescription: 2021-6-11 ak Released per governance approval. 2/19/20 tmt transferred ownership from NRDS to NCI Standards/BMaeske and restored CSIs. 11-26-19 tmt removed NCI CSI, associated with NRDS CSI and changed Registration Status. 11-25-19 tmt transferred ownership from NCI Standards to NRDS/BMaeske. 8-16-18 Created as part of the CDISC mapping task; tt.
